about.headline: About Me
about.description: Hi, I’m a german speaking Frontend Developer based near Hamburg. Motivated by the limitless opportunities within IT, I am excited about crafting visually captivating and intuitive websites and applications.
about.location: Flexible in terms of working environments, I can work effectively both on-site in Hamburg and remotely.
about.improvement: I am open-minded and always looking for personal challenges to constantly improve my knowledge and skills.
about.motivation: In my profession, programming isn't just about writing code; it's a creative form of problem-solving. I take pride in my ability to distill complex technical challenges into simple, user-friendly solutions. This way, I help you achieve your goals and bring your visions to life.

skills.headline: Skills
skills.description-small-viewport: I have gained experience in building projects with various frontend technologies and concepts.
skills.description-large-viewport: My journey has involved working on diverse projects, employing a range of frontend technologies and concepts. I am open to embracing new technologies and methodologies to Continously enhance my skills and stay ahead in the ever-evolving landscape of web development.
skills.contact-me: Feel free to contact me. I look forward to expanding on my previous knowledge.

portfolio.headline: Explore a selection of my work here - Interact with projects to see my skills in action.

EL POLLO LOCO.name: EL POLLO LOCO
EL POLLO LOCO.description: Jump, run and throw game based on object-oriented approach. Help Pepe to find coins and tabasco salsa to fight against the crazy hen.

JOIN.name: JOIN
JOIN.description: Task manager inspired by the Kanban System. Create and organize tasks using drag and drop functions, assign users and categories.

POKEDEX.name: POKEDEX
POKEDEX.description: Based on the PokéAPI a simple library that provides and catalogues pokemon information.

testimonial.testimonial-one: Patrick really kept the team together with his great organization and clear communication. We wouldn't have got this far without his commitment.
testimonial.testimonial-two: Paddy was a top team colleague at DA. His positive commitment and willingness to take on responsibility made a significant contribution to us achieving our goals.
testimonial.testimonial-three: It was a great pleasure to work with Patrick. He knows how to push and encourage team members to present the best work possible, always adding something to brainstorm. Regarding the well-being of group members, he was always present and available to listen and help others, with a great sense of humor as well

contact.headline: Contact
contact.contact-me: Contact me through this form, I am interested in hearing from you, knowing your ideas and contributing to your projects with my work.

contactform.confirm-policy: and agree to the processing of my data as outlined.

privacy-policy.headline: Privacy policy
privacy-policy.introduction: With the following data protection declaration we would like to inform you about the types of your personal Data (hereinafter also referred to as “data”) we collect for what purposes and to what extent process. The data protection declaration applies to all processing of personal data carried out by us in the As part of the provision of our services and in particular on our websites, in mobile Applications as well as within external online presences, such as. B. our social media profiles (hereinafter in summary referred to as 'online offer').
privacy-policy.gender: The terms used are not gender specific.
privacy-policy.data-storage-and-deletion: General information on data storage and deletion
privacy-policy.webhosting: Provision of the online offering and web hosting
privacy-policy.plug-in: Plug-ins and embedded functions and content
privacy-policy.process-overview-introduction: The following overview summarizes the types of data processed and the purposes of their processing and refers to the data subjects.
privacy-policy.purpose-processing-5: Provision of our online offer and user-friendliness
privacy-policy.relevant-legal-bases-introduction: Relevant legal bases according to the GDPR:
privacy-policy.relevant-legal-bases-text-1: Below you will find an overview of the Legal basis of the GDPR on the basis of which we process personal data. Please attend Knowledge that, in addition to the regulations of the GDPR, there are national data protection regulations in your or our place of residence Country of residence may apply. If more specific legal bases are relevant in individual cases, please share we You will find this in the data protection declaration.
privacy-policy.relevant-legal-bases-text-2: Consent (Art. 6 para. 1 sentence 1 lit. a) GDPR)
privacy-policy.relevant-legal-bases-text-3: The person concerned has theirs Consent to the processing of personal data concerning you for a specific person Purpose or given several specific purposes.
privacy-policy.relevant-legal-bases-text-4: Fulfillment of the contract and pre-contractual inquiries (Art. 6 para. 1 sentence 1 lit. b) GDPR)
privacy-policy.relevant-legal-bases-text-5: The processing is necessary for the performance of a contract to which the data subject is a party or in order to take steps prior to entering into a contract at the request of the data subject.
privacy-policy.relevant-legal-bases-text-6: Legitimate interests (Art. 6 para. 1 sentence 1 lit. f) GDPR)
privacy-policy.relevant-legal-bases-text-7: the processing is for necessary to protect the legitimate interests of the controller or a third party, provided that that the interests, fundamental rights and freedoms of the data subject, which ensure the protection of personal data demand data, not predominate.
privacy-policy.relevant-legal-bases-text-8: National data protection regulations in Germany:
privacy-policy.relevant-legal-bases-text-9: In addition to the data protection regulations of GDPR, national data protection regulations apply in Germany. This includes in particular the law on Protection against misuse of personal data during data processing (Federal Data Protection Act – BDSG). The BDSG contains in particular special regulations on the right to information, the right to deletion, etc Right to object, to the processing of special categories of personal data, to the processing for  other Purposes and for transmission and automated decision-making in individual cases including Profiling. Furthermore, state data protection laws of the individual federal states may apply.
privacy-policy.relevant-legal-bases-text-10: Note on the validity of the GDPR and Swiss GDPR:
privacy-policy.relevant-legal-bases-text-11: This data protection notice serves both Providing information in accordance with the Swiss Data Protection Act and the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Out of this one Reason we ask you to note that due to the broader spatial application and comprehensibility the GDPR terms are used. In particular instead of the terms used in the Swiss DSG 'Editing' 'Personal data', 'overriding interest' and 'particularly sensitive personal data' are those in the GDPR uses the terms 'processing' of 'personal data' and 'legitimate interest' and “special categories of data” is used. However, the legal meaning of the terms is defined within the framework of Validity of the Swiss DSG continues to be determined in accordance with the Swiss DSG.
privacy-policy.security-measures-text-1: We take measures in accordance with the legal requirements, taking into account the state of the artImplementation costs and the nature, scope, circumstances and purposes of the processing as well as the different probabilities of occurrence and the extent of the threat to rights and freedoms natural persons take appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure that the risk is appropriate to ensure a level of protection.
privacy-policy.security-measures-text-2: The measures include, in particular, ensuring the confidentiality, integrity and availability of Data by controlling physical and electronic access to the data as well as those relating to it access, input, distribution, ensuring availability and their separation. Furthermore, we have Procedures have been set up to exercise the rights of those affected, delete data and respond on ensure data is at risk. We also take the protection of personal data into account already in the development or selection of hardware, software and processes in accordance with the principle of Data protection, through technology design and through data protection-friendly default settings.
privacy-policy.security-measures-text-3: Securing online connections through TLS/SSL encryption technology (HTTPS): To protect the data of the user, We rely on this to protect data transmitted via our online services from unauthorized access TLS/SSL encryption technology. Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) and Transport Layer Security (TLS) are the Cornerstone of secure data transmission on the Internet. These technologies encrypt the information the transmitted between the website or app and the user's browser (or between two servers), which protects the data from unauthorized access. TLS, as the more developed and secure one version SSL ensures that all data transfers meet the highest security standards. If one If the website is secured by an SSL/TLS certificate, this is indicated by the display of HTTPS in the URL signaled. This serves as an indicator to users that their data is safe and encrypted transmitted become.
privacy-policy.transfer-of-data-text-1: As part of our processing of personal data, it may happen that these are transferred to other places, Companies, legally independent organizational units or persons are transmitted or transmitted to them be disclosed to. The recipients of this data can include: B. tasked with IT tasks Service providers include or providers of services and content that are integrated into a website. In such in these cases, we observe the legal requirements and, in particular, conclude appropriate contracts or Agreements that serve to protect your data with the recipients of your data.
privacy-policy.international-data-transfer-text-1: Data processing in third countries: If we process data in a third country (i.e. outside the European Union). union (EU), the European Economic Area (EEA)) or the processing within the framework of the Claim third party services or the disclosure or transfer of data to other persons, entities or company, this only takes place in accordance with the legal requirements. Unless that Data protection level in the third country has been recognized by means of an adequacy decision (Article 45 GDPR), This serves as the basis for data transfer. Furthermore, data transfers only take place if: Data protection level is otherwise secured, in particular through standard contractual clauses (Art. 46 Para. 2 lit. c) GDPR), express consent or in the case of contractual or legally required transmission (Art. 49 Paragraph 1 GDPR). We will also share with you the basics of third country transfers for each individual providers from third countries, with the adequacy decisions taking priority as the basis. Information on third country transfers and existing adequacy decisions can be obtained from this Offer of information from the EU Commission:
privacy-policy.international-data-transfer-text-2: As part of the so-called “Data Privacy Framework” (DPF), the EU Commission has set the data protection level also for certain companies from the USA as part of the adequacy decision of July 10, 2023 recognized. You can find the list of certified companies as well as further information about the DPF here US Department of Commerce website at
privacy-policy.international-data-transfer-text-3: (in English). As part of the data protection information, we will inform you which service providers we use are certified under the Data Privacy Framework.
privacy-policy.data-storage-and-deletion-text-1: We delete personal data that we process in accordance with the law as soon as possible underlying consents are revoked or there are no further legal basis for the processing. This applies to cases in which the original purpose of processing no longer applies or Data is no longer needed. Exceptions to this rule exist if legal obligations or special interests require longer storage or archiving of the data.
privacy-policy.data-storage-and-deletion-text-2: In particular, data that must be retained for commercial or tax reasons or whose Storage is necessary for legal prosecution or to protect the rights of other natural or legal Persons should be archived accordingly.
privacy-policy.data-storage-and-deletion-text-3: Our data protection notice contains additional information about the retention and deletion of data apply specifically to certain processing processes.
privacy-policy.data-storage-and-deletion-text-4: If there is multiple information about the retention period or deletion period for a date, the longest period is always the one decisive.
privacy-policy.data-storage-and-deletion-text-5: If a period does not expressly begin on a specific date and is at least one year, so starts automatically at the end of the calendar year in which the event triggering the deadline occurred. In the case ongoing contractual relationships under which data is stored is the event that triggers the deadline the time when the termination or other termination of the legal relationship takes effect.
privacy-policy.data-storage-and-deletion-text-6: Data that is no longer used for the originally intended purpose, but due to legal requirements or if it is stored for other reasons, we process it exclusively for the reasons that justify its storage justify.
privacy-policy.data-storage-and-deletion-text-7: Further information on processing processes, procedures and services:
privacy-policy.data-storage-and-deletion-text-9: The following general deadlines apply Storage and archiving according to German law:
privacy-policy.data-storage-and-deletion-text-10: 10 years - retention period for books and records, financial statements, inventories, Management reports, opening balance sheet and the work instructions required to understand them and other organizational documents, accounting documents and invoices (Section 147 Paragraph 3 in conjunction with Paragraph 1 No. 1, 4 and 4a AO, Section 14b Paragraph 1 UStG, Section 257 Paragraph 1 No. 1 and 4, Paragraph 4 HGB).
privacy-policy.data-storage-and-deletion-text-11: 6 years - Other business documents: commercial or business letters received, reproductions of the sent commercial or business letters, other documents insofar as they are required for taxation from Meaning are, e.g. B. hourly wage sheets, company accounting sheets, calculation documents, Price labels, but also payroll documents, if they are not already available Booking documents are and cash register strips (Section 147 Paragraph 3 in conjunction with Paragraph 1 Nos. 2, 3, 5 AO, Section 257 Paragraph 1 Nos. 2 and 3, Para.4 HGB).
privacy-policy.data-storage-and-deletion-text-12: 3 years - dates required to address potential warranty and claims for damages or similar contractual claims and rights as well as those associated therewith inquiries based on previous business experience and common industry practices, become stored for the duration of the regular statutory limitation period of three years (§§ 195, 199 BGB).
privacy-policy.rights-text-1: Rights of data subjects under the GDPR: As data subjects, you have various rights under the GDPR to, which result in particular from Articles 15 to 21 GDPR:
privacy-policy.rights-text-2: Right to object: You have the right to object for reasons relating to your particular situation at any time, object to the processing of personal data concerning you based on from Art. 6 Para. 1 lit. e or f GDPR to lodge an objection; this also applies to one on this Regulation-based profiling. If your personal data is processed, around to conduct direct advertising, you have the right to object to the processing of your data at any time she to submit relevant personal data for the purpose of such advertising; this also applies to the profiling to the extent that it is related to such direct advertising.
privacy-policy.rights-text-4: You have the right to consent given any time to revoke.
privacy-policy.rights-text-6: You have the right to request confirmation as to whether concerned data is processed and to information about this data as well as further information and a copy of the data in accordance with legal requirements.
privacy-policy.rights-text-8: In accordance with legal requirements, you have the right to request that the data concerning you be completed or that incorrect data concerning you be corrected.
privacy-policy.rights-text-9: Right to deletion and restriction of processing:
privacy-policy.rights-text-10: In accordance with the legal requirements, you have the right to demand that data concerning you be deleted immediately, or alternatively, in accordance with the legal requirements, to request a restriction on the processing of the data.
privacy-policy.rights-text-12: You have the right to receive data concerning you that you have provided to us in a structured, common and machine-readable format in accordance with legal requirements or to request that it be transmitted to another person responsible.
privacy-policy.rights-text-14: Without prejudice to any other administrative or judicial remedy, you have the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority, in particular in the Member State of your habitual residence, your place of work or the place of the alleged infringement, if you believe that the processing of your personal data violates the violates the requirements of the GDPR.
privacy-policy.webhosting-text-1: We process users' data in order to be able to provide them with our online services. For this purpose, we process the user's IP address, which is necessary to transmit the content and functions of our online services to the user's browser or device
privacy-policy.webhosting-text-3: Usage data (e.g. page views and length of stay, click paths, usage intensity and frequency, device types and operating systems used, interactions with content and functions); Meta, communication and procedural data (e.g. IP addresses, times, identification numbers, people involved). Protocol data (e.g. log files regarding logins or the retrieval of data or access times.).
privacy-policy.webhosting-text-5: Users (e.g. website visitors, users of online services).
privacy-policy.webhosting-text-7: Provision of our online offering and user-friendliness; Information technology infrastructure (operation and provision of information systems and technical devices (computers, servers, etc.).). Security measures.
privacy-policy.webhosting-text-9: Deletion in accordance with the information in the section 'General information on data storage and deletion'.
privacy-policy.webhosting-text-11: Legitimate interests (Art. 6 Para. 1 Sentence 1 Letter f) GDPR).
privacy-policy.webhosting-text-12: Further information on processing processes, procedures and services:
privacy-policy.webhosting-text-13: Collection of access data and log files:
privacy-policy.webhosting-text-14: Access to our online offering is logged in the form of so-called 'server log files'. The server log files include the address and name of the websites and files accessed, date and time of access, amount of data transferred, notification of successful retrieval, browser type and version, the user's operating system, referrer URL (the previously visited page) and, as a rule, IP addresses and the requesting provider. The server log files can be used for security purposes, e.g. B. to avoid overloading the servers (especially in the case of abusive attacks, so-called DDoS attacks), and on the other hand to ensure the utilization of the servers and their stability;
privacy-policy.webhosting-text-16: Log file information is stored for a maximum of 30 days and then deleted or anonymized. Data whose further storage is necessary for evidentiary purposes is excluded from deletion until the respective incident has been finally clarified.
privacy-policy.webhosting-text-17: Services in the field of providing information technology infrastructure and related services (e.g. storage space and/or computing capacity);
privacy-policy.contact-text-1: When you contact us (e.g. by post, contact form, e-mail, telephone or via social media) as well as within the framework of existing user and business relationships, the information provided by the inquiring person is processed to the extent that this is necessary to answer the contact inquiries and any enquiries measures are required.
privacy-policy.contact-text-3: Inventory data (e.g. full name, home address, contact information, customer number, etc.); Contact information (e.g. postal and email addresses or telephone numbers); Content data (e.g. textual or visual messages and posts as well as the information relating to them, such as information on authorship or time of creation); Usage data (e.g. page views and length of stay, click paths, usage intensity and frequency, device types and operating systems used, interactions with content and functions). Meta, communication and procedural data (e.g. IP addresses, times, identification numbers, people involved).
privacy-policy.contact-text-7: Communication; organizational and administrative procedures; Feedback (e.g. collecting feedback via online form). Provision of our online offering and user-friendliness.
privacy-policy.contact-text-9: Deletion in accordance with the information in the section 'General information on data storage and deletion'
privacy-policy.contact-text-10: Fulfillment of the contract and pre-contractual inquiries (Art. 6 para. 1 sentence 1 lit. b) GDPR).
privacy-policy.contact-text-11: Further information on processing processes, procedures and services:
privacy-policy.contact-text-13: When you contact us via our contact form, by email or other communication channels, we process the personal data transmitted to us to answer and process the respective request. This usually includes information such as name, contact information and, if necessary, other information that is provided to us and is necessary for appropriate processing. We use this data exclusively for the stated purpose of contacting and communicating;
privacy-policy.plug-in-text-1: We include functional and content elements in our online offering that are obtained from the servers of their respective providers (hereinafter referred to as 'third-party providers'). This can be, for example, graphics, videos or city maps (hereinafter referred to as 'content').
privacy-policy.plug-in-text-2: The integration always requires that the third party providers of this content process the users' IP address, as without an IP address they would not be able to send the content to their browser. The IP address is therefore required to display this content or functions. We strive to only use content whose respective providers only use the IP address to deliver the content. Third parties may also use so-called pixel tags (invisible graphics, also known as 'web beacons') for statistical or marketing purposes. The 'pixel tags' can be used to evaluate information such as visitor traffic on the pages of this website. The pseudonymous information can also be stored in cookies on the user's device and may contain, among other things, technical information about the browser and operating system, referring websites, time of visit and other information about the use of our online offering, but also linked to such information from other sources become.
privacy-policy.plug-in-text-4: If we ask users for their consent to the use of third-party providers, the legal basis for data processing is permission. Otherwise, the user data will be processed on the basis of our legitimate interests (i.e. interest in efficient, economical and recipient-friendly services). In this context, we would also like to draw your attention to the information on the use of cookies in this data protection declaration.
privacy-policy.plug-in-text-6: Usage data (e.g. page views and length of stay, click paths, usage intensity and frequency, device types and operating systems used, interactions with content and functions). Meta, communication and procedural data (e.g. IP addresses, times, identification numbers, people involved).
privacy-policy.plug-in-text-8: Users (e.g. website visitors, users of online services).
privacy-policy.plug-in-text-10: Provision of our online offering and user-friendliness.
privacy-policy.plug-in-text-12: Deletion in accordance with the information in the section 'General information on data storage and deletion'. Storage of cookies for up to 2 years (Unless otherwise stated, cookies and similar storage methods may be stored on users' devices for a period of two years).
privacy-policy.plug-in-text-14: Further information on processing processes, procedures and services:
privacy-policy.plug-in-text-16: Provision of font files for the purpose of a user-friendly presentation of our online offering;
privacy-policy.plug-in-text-18: The Google Fonts are hosted on our server, no data is transmitted to Google;
privacy-policy.plug-in-text-19: Created with the free Data Protection Generator.de by Dr. Thomas Schwenke
